data.text: If thou do good, know to whom thou doest it;
Do good to a godly man, and thou shalt find a recompense;
There shall no good come to him that continueth to do evil,
Do good to one that is lowly,
For the Most High also hateth sinners,
A man’s friend will not be Or, punished  fully tried in prosperity;
In a man’s prosperity his enemies are grieved;
Though he humble himself, and go crouching,
Who will pity a charmer that is bitten with a serpent,
Even so who will pity  him that goeth to a sinner,
For a while he will abide with thee,
And the enemy will speak sweetly with his lips,
If adversity meet thee, thou shalt find him there before thee;
He will shake his head, and clap his hands,
